lines.text: I can't bow my head to any man and call him master. I believe in myself. I take responsibility for myself.
I'll be ready in a minute. Can I offer you something?
How about settling or a cold beer?
What will I be called upon to do?
the pleasure of ignorance, or offspring, or an easy death.
Wil I be asked to give up even love?
The universe is love. That you shall have.
None of us is ever alone.
I am several hundred years too old to be alright.

If I were to tell you that ignorance has been a kind of protection for you and that there's a price you have to pay if you are to understand your destiny, would you still choose understanding over ignorance?
I am still a woman. And the man attracts me.
Then you find no satisfaction in my service?
I would feel the warmth of a mans arms again... after all these years alone...
You're a crafty old man. But if I can't destroy you here, you'll come with me on the wings of demons to a place where I can.
